info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 4:39AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Schenectady, Albany, northwestern Greene, Schoharie and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 530 AM EDT... At 439 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Elk Creek to near Prattsville. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Gilboa and Prattsville around 445 AM EDT. Richmondville, Sharon Springs, Preston Hollow and Preston-Potter Hollow around 455 AM EDT. Cobleskill around 500 AM EDT. Westerlo and Central Bridge around 505 AM EDT. Ravena, Delanson, Selkirk and Feura Bush around 515 AM EDT. Duanesburg around 520 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Charleston, West Settlement, Clarksville, East Berne, Beekman Corners, West Richmondville, Shoefelt Corners, Rockwell Corners, West Berne and Huntersland. This includes the following highways... Interstate 88 between exits 20 and 23. Interstate 87 near exit 21A. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
